IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: BROOKS SCHOOL IS A COLLEGE PREPARATORY SCHOOL THAT SEEKS TO PROVIDE THE MOST MEANINGFUL EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE OUR STUDENTS WILL HAVE IN THEIR LIVES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BROOKS SCHOOL IS A COLLEGE PREPARATORY SCHOOL THAT SEEKS TO PROVIDE THE MOST MEANINGFUL EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE OUR STUDENTS WILL HAVE IN THEIR LIVES.
IRS990.Desc: SECONDARY EDUCATION COLLEGE PREPARATORY SCHOOL FOR BOARDING AND DAY STUDENTS WITH EDUCATIONAL AND AUXILIARY SCHOOL ACTIVITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUMMER SCHOOL PROGRAM EDUCATIONAL SUMMER CAMP FOR APPROXIMATELY 450 CAMPERS PER WEEK FOR EIGHT WEEKS, AGES FOUR TO TWELVE AND TWO ACADEMIC CAMPS FOR APPROXIMATELY 420 STUDENTS ENTERING GRADES THREE TO TWELVE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: EXTRACURRICULAR SPORTS PROGRAM SKATING RINK USED FOR INTERSCHOLASTIC COMPETITION AS PART OF THE SCHOOL ATHLETIC PROGRAM AS WELL AS FOR INSTRUCTIONAL PURPOSES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDE LIBRARY, SNACK BAR FOR STUDENTS, MUSIC LESSONS, CAMPUS STORE, AND MISCELLANEOUS SERVICES FOR STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INTENDED USE OF THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE FOR EDUCATIONAL AND SPECIAL PROGRAMS, FINANCIAL AID, PLANT MAINTENANCE AND GENERAL PURPOSES.

IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, THE SCHOOL IS GENERALLY EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME. HOWEVER, THE SCHOOL DOES INCUR FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. IN DETERMINING THE RECOGNITION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, THE SCHOOL APPLIES A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND DETERMINES THE MEASUREMENT OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS CONSIDERING THE AMOUNTS AND PROBABILITIES OF THE OUTCOMES THAT COULD BE REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT WITH TAXING AUTHORITIES. AS OF JUNE 30, 2016, THE SCHOOL HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOL IS GENERALLY SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR THE PRIOR THREE YEARS.
FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS 4,770,890. COST OF GOODS SOLD -157,397.
FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS 4,770,890. COST OF GOODS SOLD -157,397.
BROOKS SCHOOL PUBLISHES ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY AS A MEMBER SCHOOL OF THE ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS IN NEW ENGLAND (AISNE).
FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE GRANTED TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICES FOR FINANCIAL AID (SSS) OF PRINCETON, NEW JERSEY
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES ON-CAMPUS HOUSING FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, ADMINISTRATIVE AND FACULTY MEMBERS. JOHN PACKARD, JR., $36,000 JAMES HAMILTON, $30,000 LAWRENCE CALLAHAN, $30,000 GAGE DOBBINS, $24,000
THE NUMBER REPORTED IN COLUMN (B) OF SCHEDULE M REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS OF EACH ITEM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE FULL FORM 990 WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SCHEDULE B AND THEN RECOMMENDS APPROVAL TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE DISCLOSURES ON SCHEDULE B ARE DISCUSSED WITH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE BY MANAGEMENT BUT THE FORM ITSELF IS NOT PROVIDED DUE TO THE SENSITIVITY OF DONORS' PERSONAL INFORMATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ADDITION TO THE SIGNED ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, PRIOR TO THE START OF DISCUSSION OR NEGOTIATION OF FINANCIAL MATTERS, TRUSTEES AND EMPLOYEES ARE EXPECTED TO MAKE FULL DISCLOSURE OF ANY DUAL INTEREST IN A PROPOSED TRANSACTION. A TRUSTEE OR EMPLOYEE WITH A DUAL INTEREST IN A PROPOSED TRANSACTION SHALL NOT VOTE ON THE MATTER AND DEPENDING ON THE CIRCUMSTANCES, MAY BE EXCLUDED FROM ANY DISCUSSION OF THE MATTER. THE BUSINESS OFFICE REGULARLY MONITORS ITS CONTRACTS AND CASH DISBURSEMENTS TO DETERMINE IF THERE IS AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH ANY PERSON COVERED BY THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES ARE DETERMINED BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, JOHN PACKARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. FORM 990 IS PUBLISHED ON THE GUIDESTAR WEBSITE AND IS ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC. AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AND THE MASSACHUSETTS ATTORNEY GENERAL WEBSITE.

DURING 2016, THE SCHOOL RETROSPECTIVELY ADOPTED FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD ("FASB") ACCOUNTING STANDARDS UPDATE ("ASU") NO. 2015-03, INTEREST-IMPUTATION OF INTEREST (SUBTOPIC 835-30) - SIMPLIFYING THE PRESENTATION OF DEBT ISSUANCE COSTS, AND DEBT ISSUANCE COSTS ARE NOW PRESENTED AS A DEDUCTION OF BOND PAYABLE ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR EACH YEAR. ACCORDINGLY, BOND PAYABLE ORIGINALLY STATED AT $22,422,933 IN THE JUNE 30, 2015 FINANCIAL STATEMENTS HAS BEEN RESTATED TO $22,081,885 TO REFLECT $341,048 OF UNAMORTIZED ISSUANCE COSTS PREVIOUSLY REPORTED AS AN ASSET IN DEFERRED BOND ISSUANCE COSTS. ADDITIONALLY, DURING 2016, THE SCHOOL RETROSPECTIVELY ADOPTED FASB ASU NO. 2015-07, FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENT (TOPIC 820) - DISCLOSURES FOR INVESTMENTS IN CERTAIN ENTITIES THAT CALCULATE NET ASSET VALUE PER SHARE (OR ITS EQUIVALENT), AND INVESTMENTS VALUED AT NET ASSET VALUE (NAV) ARE NOW PRESENTED IN A SEPARATE COLUMN IN THE RELATED FOOTNOTE DISCLOSURE FOR 2016 AND 2015. IN ADDITION, CERTAIN AMOUNTS FROM THE PRIOR YEAR'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WERE RECLASSIFIED IN ORDER TO CONFORM TO THE CURRENT YEAR'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

RelatedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CHARITABLE GIFT ANNUITIES (10) - PER IRS INSTRUCTIONS
